text: SliTaz GNU/Linux is a software project started by Christophe Lincoln in 2006. It is one of the smallest desktop Linux distributions available It can be loaded entirely into RAM or be installed to a hard drive. == History == SliTaz 1.0 was released on March 22, 2008. SliTaz shares many common goals with Damn Small Linux, but is smaller and based on the more recent Linux 2.6 kernel. == Issues == Version Stability Release date 1.0 stable version March 22, 2008 2.0 stable version March 2009 3.0 stable version March 2010 4.0 stable version April 10, 2012 Raspberry Pi ARM platform March 29, 2014 5.0RC-1 Release Candidate 1 May 2, 2014 5.0RC-2 Release Candidate 2 May 19, 2014 5.0 Cooking Unstable / Rolling Release November 5, 2017 == Gallery == Image:SliTaz-GNU- Linux 1.png|Stable 1.0 Image:SliTaz-Ver2.0-screenshot.png|Stable 2.0 Image:SliTaz-Ver3.0-screenshot.png|Stable 3.0 Image:Slitaz-4.0.png|Stable 4.0 Image:Slitaz-cooking-20101104.png|Cooking 5.0 == References == == Other websites == * SliTaz GNU/Linux official website Category:Linux distributions
